page.title: 02THE GROWTH OF CARLISLE
page.content: Carlisle stands on high ground between the River Eden and a plain.There are signs of ancient settlements here.Car- lisle's centre is on the site of the Roman city near Hadrian's Wall.This became the medieval walled city with its castle,cathedral and gates.The city did not grow much beyond its walls until the 18th century because of wars with Scotland.Real growth came with the arrival of industry and the railway.In the 19th century an industrial area grew up to the West <p.7>while housing spread in all dir- ections except the North.The main developments North of the river have been in the 20th century.All outer areas of the city now have modern suburbs:in this block they are seen in the North and West<p.8-18>.Older villages still keep some character as the town surrounds them.
